ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I greatly improved my Arabic, especially my speaking and communication skills.

Man, they weren't lying at all when they said this course would be a lot of work! Do be prepared because this is going to be a constant load of homework that you will continuously have to grind. Without a doubt, the amount of time that you spend will discipline you and prepare you for L5 Arabic, because you are constantly engaging with the language. I have definitely learned a lot more vocabulary and ways to express myself, my thoughts, etc.
I learned more grammar and vocabulary as well as how to apply my skills to interpreting authentic documents and videos.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: While not fully immersive (like a study abroad would be, for example), the course was still pretty intense and required dedicated study time every day.  As as a result, my Arabic has improved rapidly.  I also think that the necessary online-ness was handled well (helped also of course by our small class size), and I felt engaged despite being alone in my room and (shhhh!) in boxer shorts.  I'm sure the course could be improved somehow, but I'm not really sure how unfortunately, so I can't give any helpful feedback there - I thought it was quite good as is.  Obviously the online-ness made things less efficient and the digital audio occasionally amplified my struggles to understand spoken arabic, but that's not remediable really unless we take to global coronavirus policy-making or virological research.  Also, all feedback and grading was impressively speedy.  (Also just a note, I put below that the workload was greater than most courses, but I don't think its a fair comparison since its an intensive summer class not taken alongside 3 or 4 others like in the year)

Great course; I learned so much in 5 weeks. I often felt that my speaking skills were not up to par, especially given that I had taken the past 1.5 semesters of Arabic remotely, but I don't know how that could have been improved. Natakallam was great, but I wish we had started earlier in the course. The Yale language tutor program was not at all equipped to handle the class schedule, but that was not the instructor's fault.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, your Arabic will improve greatly.
Yes. This class was informative, interesting, and challenging. Even on Zoom, Prof. Al Ani was so good at giving each of us individualized attention.
